alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 11:20AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN YORK AND NORTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH NOON EDT... At 1117 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm that was nearly stationary 2 miles east of Bioling Springs. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Lower Allen, Mechanicsburg, Camp Hill, Boiling Springs, Dillsburg, Shiremanstown, Siddonsburg, Hogestown and Messiah College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding of small streams, particularly between Boiling Springs and Dillsburg. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
